title: Earthquake jolts different parts of country
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 28 (APP): An earthquake of magnitude 6.0 on the Richter scale jolted different parts of the country on Sunday morning.
According to details, tremors were also felt in twin cities Rawalpindi, Islamabad and other cities which include Lahore, Peshawar, Swabi, Swat, Punjab, Gilgit Baltistan (GB), Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP).
No damages have been reported so far.
The epicentre of the earthquake was deep near Hindu Kush range at the Afghanistan-Tajikistan border region and at a depth of around 220km, a private news channel reported.
